Manager Response: Please accept our apologies for the unpleasant experience you had with us. I will let our housekeeping and maintenance department know about the issues you mentioned to perfect those areas.we have a company that comes at a weekly basis and keeps rooms upto date when it comes to bugs of any sort, rooms where inspected and no signs of bed bugs where found,  We hope you will give us another opportunity to better serve you in the near future. Summary: WHO WANTS TO SLEEP IN A DIRTY ROOM? Then this place is for you! If you like your shower water not draining COME ON DOWN! If you like MOTION DETECTION LIGHTS IN YOUR ROOM GOING OFF AND ON ALL NIGHT THEN THIS IS THE PLACE! But if you like not feeling as if you just slept in a murder scene hotel room then don't stay here.
Only problem I had with my stay was we were supposed to have connected rooms and they gave our room to someone else

Where to start, lol I can understand when you book a cheap hotel it isn't going to be fancy but the hot tub was cold, our room key had to be reprogrammed everyday, the toilet was broken, they ran out of hot water in hotel our last day, they never gave us enough towels even though we asked for 3 each day and had a 4 person room, and to top it off they ran out of the continental breakfast within an hour each day, lol

Hello, the bathrooms were in need of upgrading.  The tiles and tub had lots of wear.  The wifi was not usable.  Upon check-in, I asked how the wifi was since we were towards the end of the hotel.  He said it was great, there are two networks.  Just one of our devices could see one of the two networks, and it was not able to connect for more than a few seconds.

Summary Heading: nb whiners: superb bundled features, AND god for free!

Made you feel guilty for eating any of the food! Not a comfortable feeling. I can see posting 1 sign, but they were all over the place! I requested more blankets and had to insist they call the manager just to get those! Not a good experience at all! They are very cheap and they lie!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback in regards to your recent stay. My sincere apologies for the mix up during your check in. I would love the chance to personally make sure your next stay is an all-out success. We really do want to win you over. Sincerely, Richard F

Summary: I stayed for 2 days and couldn't be happier with my decision. The staff were helpful, the room was nice and clean although not many channels. Free morning breakfast, lots of parking and with close to everything. No elevator though so if you have luggage and you end up on the 2nd floor be ready to use stairs. Internet is slow though.
Manager Response: Dear Elime2013, Thank you for reviewing your recent stay at Howard Johnson - Buena Park. We are so happy to hear your stay went well and it is also very kind of you to detail your stay so others reading our reviews can really get a feel for our hotel. We thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you back soon. Kind Regards,

Summary: Although our room was a bit noisey due to some pipes in the wall it was a decent room.  We stay at least 5 days a month somewhere and this room would be average to low on our standards for the price.  They need to upgrade somethings.  The breakfast room and food was very good and the staff excellent.  We would stay again for the price alone.
Manager Response: Greetings Richard V, thank you for sharing this wonderful review with the tripadvisor community. We do appreciate all your comments and the rating given, i will let my staff know they did a great job at providing service. Thank you again for choosing our hotel as your travel destination. We are looking forward to welcome you back and we want to make sure that next time you have even a better stay. Best Regards...

Summary: I stayed here for a vacation with my best friend for 3 nights. We showed up a bit late and the guy working hardly even said hello. I saw a sign mentioning a $100 deposit and when I asked about it he casually mentioned that he already swiped my credit card for it. The room was ok, but lacked some basic amenities like body soap and conditioner. The only saving grace was the woman working the morning shift. I told her about our sink not draining and she quickly apologized and made a note for housekeeping. The problem was resolved by the time we returned that night.

Stayed here for four days and can't really complain. It was clean and nice though it was older you could tell from the outlets and cabinets in the bathroom. Everyone was very polite and nice that worked there and j had no issues a little loud from the neighbors but that can happen anywhere.
This motel was a good value for the price. Everyone was extremely friendly and the rooms were clean.

I will let our housekeeping and maintenance department know about the issues you mentioned to perfect those areas. We hope you will give us another opportunity to better serve you in the near future. Summary: I thought this place was nice but the only thing I didn't like was that there were a lot of smokers. They had designated places but it was hard to avoid the cigarette smoke. It was OK I just needed to get away after a week of finals. I liked the larger room with the two queen beds more than the king size bedroom.

This is not a 5 or 4 star hotel by any means, but it is very decent and clean for the price. My family and I were very satisfied with our stay. Beds and pillows were comfortable and the room was roomy and clean. My brother and his family were staying at the Holiday Inn a couple of blocks away from us and he was complaining about encountering roaches in his room and yeat he was paying more than twice my nightly rate. The complementary breakfast was very decent. I would definately stay here again if I am in the area.

We rented four rooms for our family, so we can be close to a family funeral that we attended.  The location was very convenient.  We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, and the services was nice. Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear Samison, Thank you for reviewing your recent stay at Howard Johnson - Buena Park. We thank you again for staying with us and we hope to see you back soon. Kind Regards,

Summary: This is your topical H J hotel but the location is very good to all the parks and attractions. Also there is a mall and a lot of good restaurants close by. The rooms are nice and large with a good bathroom the breakfast is very light and very short on its time limit . but all in all it was an OK place to stay. the rates are a little high but you pay for the close location.

We are in the process of updating our hotel and services. We look forward to welcoming you back in an effort to provide you the level of service you expect from Howard Johnson hotels.  sincerely: Ricardo F

Manager Response: Please accept our apologies for the unpleasant experience you had with us. please call the hotel in regards the fee for a 2nd floor room, we don't have such fee, unless if its for a business king or a suite. so don't hesitate to call the hotel to investigate this and get it sorted out.. We hope you will give us another opportunity to better serve you in the near future. Sincerely, Richard

This was after I spent over $6,000 at this hotel! (I have the receipts)  I stay at hotels for business travel and this was absolutely the worst nightmare experience I have ever endured!!   They canceled my reservation as I was in a shuttle from the Airport about 5 minutes away from the hotel!!  Amy actually laughed on the phone when she told me she could cancel anyone's reservation, any time she wanted to.  She also wanted me to know that she would no longer make reservations

Summary: I have stayed at Howard Johnson hotels in the past, and honestly, I wasn't that satisfied, but Buena Park Howard Johnson was an exception and I'm so pleased I took the chance!  The hotel staff was friendly, the lobby area was neat, tidy and comfortable.  The pool area was very clean and pleasant, and there were also several seating areas around the property that were perfect for relaxing with a coffee or a cigarette in the fresh air.  The room was very spacious and had a microwave, mini fridge and bar area, A+ on that!  The beds at Howard Johnson are fair, they aren't the most comfortable but this one seemed to be slightly more comfortable.  I was impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel.  The continental breakfast was nice, except I do wish there had been more fruit offered
Manager Response: Dear rose826 , Thank you for your AMAZING review. We are really proud to hear that we were able to accommodate your travel needs and service was as you expected. Thank you for choosing HOJO Buena Park for your travel destination and we are looking forward to welcome you and your family back soon! Sincerely, Richard

Summary: I was charged a security deposit,  I wasnt renting an apartment.  Still haven't received that back. Will never stay at your lodgings again. Nor will I ever recommend you
Manager Response: Please accept our apologies for the unpleasant experience you had with us. and you are correct you are not renting an apartment, you are renting a room, just like when you rent a car(there is a deposit) deposits are for the simple purpose of there being any additional fees to ones room-car-apt-movie rental places etc, could mean long distance/extra requests/upgrades/damages etc.  We hope you understand and will give us another opportunity to better serve you in the near future. Sincerely, Richard

Summary: Very outdated, uncaring staff reported issues such as noise manager uninterested. Stayed for four nights. Breakfast is not continental is just a bunch of different breads and tang. I was asked to wait while a housekeeper checked the room for my deposit. The only reason I gave a two is because they were smart enough to hire their night clerk Anthony he was extremely professional and helpful. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Just an average hotel door was open when we got to our room.  Double beds vice Queen beds, no floor mat for shower no wash cloths had to go to get them at the front desk.  Noise level was terrible guests too loud at 0100 in the morning. Shower was in terrible shape

The bathroom shower bar was suppose to be curved it was not. The shower curtain did not fit (did not close all the way). The one thing that was not cool about this hotel. It was about 11pm and people were yelling across the hall. Quiet time is 10pm.

I stayed here over the weekend. I went down to LA for a concert and wanted to stay at cheaper hotel. We got a room in the newly added building. It was so much better than the older building. It was so clean and much bigger. The sink and extra vanity was a nice touch. It was a room with one queen bed. It was really quiet and the staff was really good. I think they have different staff now than the last time I was there. If you want to stay here ask for a room in the new building :)
Place was good and location convenient.  No note pads and pen/pencil provided, No Bible either which is pretty standard.

Summary Heading: Good location for Knotts Berry Park
Summary: This is a good cheap hotel, nothing special but certainly we had a quiet, large and comfortable room. If you are wanting to visit the Disney theme parks this one is a bit further away, but still within 10-15 minute drive. The breakfast area was the biggest of our trip and reasonable variety of food (though I hope you like strawberry jam on you toast). Several restaurants within walking distance. Due to price we actually paid for an extra night so we could late check out at 7pm for a late flight.
Manager Response: .Thanks for taking the time to review the Buena Park Howard Johnson. It's great to read you enjoyed your overall stay. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to BP!  Sincerely; Ricardo

Summary: I had a recently updated room that spacious,clean and funtional. Bed was comfortable and the linens were clean and crisp. My only critisism of the room is that the air conditioner drowned out the tv when it would kick on, it was very loud. The internet only worked sporatically. After dicussing this with the staff and told nothing was wrong with it I just gave up trying to use it.
Manager Response: Dear Bob W;  Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to comment. Summary: We stayed here during spring break in March.  Friendly staff at the front desk checked in with no problems. We were happy to get a ground floor room like we requested online. A bonus for us was getting the rooms right by the barbecue grill and patio.  The bed was nice and soft and our sheets were clean.  Breakfast was your usual waffles, cereal and toast. The pool and jacuzzi needed to be cleaned at the time but was no deal breaker. We did have some rather noisy neighbors which was no fault of the place. The drive is not long if you are visiting Disneyland like we did.
Manager Response: Thank you again! We enjoyed having you at our hotel and we certainly appreciate the great review. Your loyalty is paramount and we can't wait until you come back again! i have notified our pool cleaning company and i can assure you that next time you come back it will nice and clean. The next day, we asked Richard/Ricardo at the

Some of the rooms are used a majority of the time during the off season and it shows. The result high usage re-quires more maintenance as: paint, carpet and other items as an updated iron and ironing board or worn out latches or switches. Overall the pool area was well kept and the staff were very helpful.
OK for cost. No elevator. Room was reserved for three but only one bed without a sofa bed. Would not come back.

My husband and I stayed here for one night to avoid driving back home from a car show at Knottsberry farm. This hotel is wonderfully close to the park, not quite walking distance while lugging several bags (~1 mile)  We booked the hotel for the hot tub, location, and price ($95, sat night). After finding out a kink in our schedule, we were unable to take advantage of the hot tub/pool or free breakfast.  The room was large. The bathroom was ok.  We received a good nights sleep. And there was working wifi.  However, had I known our schedule, I would have booked a cheaper hotel with no amenities.

The front desk was courteous but not overly "let me go out of your way to help". The room and facilities were clean. However, don't expect room service every day, even if you don't put out the Do Not Disturb notice. I stayed 4 nights and came back to the room on the 3rd night to find that nobody had stopped by to make the bed, clean the bathrooms, or re-stock the towels. I had to go up to the front desk to ask for more towels, but they were out of hand towels (bath towels and washcloths were available). The next day, room service came and cleaned but didn't leave any hand towels and not enough of the rest, so we had to go back up to the front and ask for it.  Breakfast was acceptable: cereal, waffles, bagels & toast, juice & coffee. Minimal fruit. 9am end time every day

Summary Heading: Howard Johnson Near Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: STAFF: Most of the help desk was wonderful. I was there 4 days and there was just one employee that seemed bothered when you interrupted his tv watching but other than him, the rest of the staff was cuourtrous and helpful.  BREAKFAST:  It was a continental breakfast, so one can't really complain. The breakfast was decent; bread & butter, beagles & cream cheese, milk, orange & apple juice, oatmeal, cereal, coffee & tea, and they had waffles. But you had to get there VERY early otherwise the line for waffles becomes a longer wait than at Knotts Berry Farm.  ROOM: Although it's obviously an older hotel, the rooms were spacious and clean. The try to make them look modernized, so kuddos to them. There's a fridge & microwave in each room. The beds were amazingly comfortable. House

Summary Heading: Good price you get what you pay for.
Summary: The smell of the room must have had smokers previously . Most things in room adequate . Night staff could not answer question about Check out early in morning . Good value had BQ for guests.

Summary Heading: Great if your just wanting a place to sleep and wash
Summary: We stayed here for 7 days from 1st March. Room was standard, clean and had everything you needed  (microwave, fridge, tv, safe, hair dryer) We only booked this hotel as a place to stay as we had plenty planned while we was in Cali (Knotts Berry, Universal, San Diego, Disneyland, All the beaches, Hollywood) The hotel is located close to the freeway (but not too close that it creates noise problems) Its also close to a McDonalds, Dennys and petrol station. Parking was good and right next to the rooms (Motel Style) The hotel has laundry facilities aswell as drinks vending machine and ice machine. The pool has lots of bugs and things on the surface when we went but a couple of days in the pool was cleaned and looked spotless afterwards.  On summary this hotel is perfect if your

This is exactly what you would expect from a large chain 3 star hotel. Its not fancy, there are no bells and whistles, but the staff are extremely nice, and the rooms were clean. My only 'complaint' and really, im just whining is that when we returned to the hotel each night from Disneyland, we would be dying of thirst. Each night we tried to get ice and it was completely out. Completely out. That was a little annoying. Also, my key card stopped working after the first day and each night, again, after a long day at Disney we would have to walk all the way down to the office and have them re scan it. Frustrating, but the staff there couldn't have been more apologetic and helpful. We will return.

While checking in a man was trying to clear up his charges from a previous stay, seems the motel charged his card when he already paid via a website, the manager was very rude to the man and after he left she called the employee responsible for the error and read her the riot act right in front of my wife and I. Also, very poor breakfast selection.

The room was big and tidy. Staffs were polite and were kind enough to lend us an adapter, as we forgot to bring one, so that we can charge our gadgets. The only problem that we had was that there were no elevators and they gave us a room on the second floor. The rooms were in a different building from the reception, so you will have to walk a little bit, and carry your heavy stuffs by yourselves.

Summary Heading: A Motel 6 would have been better
Summary: I had to get a last minute hotel room for me and my infant son and they would accommodate me to the 1st floor, there was no elevator, and no one to help me carry the multitude of items up to the second floor.  Extremely rude staff, horrible quality of room, the thermostat didn't work, the water is disgusting and the walls are paper thin. I will NEVER stay here again.

Dislike: peeling surface on toilet seat  (it's easy and inexpensive to replace toilet seats, do it today)  horrid movie on in lobby upon check in, filthy trim on fridge (I had disinfectant wipes with me, so we cleaned the fridge)  read on a website that free shuttle was available when in fact there was no shuttle, sign on front desk stating $1.50 was automatically charged to bill for in room safe, and would be refunded at check out.  ??? I asked for refund, was told I was never charged.  Make up your mind, people. Room was decorated nicely, beds comfy.  Microwave & fridge, once we cleaned both, were convenient. Nice courtyard outside of room to gather before heading out for the day.
I was in a family vacation and on my way back home when I rented a room at Howard Johnston and was pleased with the service but the rim quality was poor.

This is the 2nd time we stayed in a Howard Johnson. And both stay were very pleasant. In fact, both my husband and I had a pleasant continuous sleep. The staff were very accommodating. David at the front desk and Jenny as well. The breakfast was cool.. . . what with the waffle that we did ourselves. For the price, it was more than a five star stay .

When I booked in Hotels.com I had made reservation for 2 room 2 bed, but when I checked in they told they don't have 2 rooms, I paid $10 extra assuming I will be getting 2 rooms and 2 beds, instead I got one room with two double beds.  At the time of booking one room two queen beds was $10 less, I paid more and got one room with small beds for additional price.
It was great our stay there . Although we put in a room with just a bed and had requested and paid with 2 beds. But not changed room .

Rooms were small but clean. Staff was not very professional(was greeted by front desk clerk "what's up dude" . Breakfast was okay but needed some kind of protein i.e. peanut butter or hard boiled eggs. Wi-Fi connection not very good, keep getting kicked off and having to resign in.

Worse experience, when I made the reservation on line they show a very nice place to stay, and when my husband and I arrived they send us to an old  building next door, it look worse than a motel 6 and not very safe, and furniture was dusty.

Summary Heading: Front desk staff was not friendly
Summary: Room above us was too noisy couldn't sleep . Felt like someone above our room was walking all night we could hear every step. Very hard for us to fall asleep.

Summary Heading: This was the second time staying at Howard Johnson Buena...
Summary: This was the second time staying at Howard Johnson Buena Park.  It was nice and pleasant, no problems.  It is a bit far but reasonably priced from Long Beach, California where I was visiting friends and relatives.
The breakfast was good, the bed was good, the front desk was friendly and helpful.  The carpets are worn.  The door was hanging crooked.  Overall it just needs to be refurbished.

Very Clean, Very Quite place to stay. Staff was very friendly, and breakfast was a bonus. Hotel is Located close to Disney, and Knotts, with easy access to freeway. I would stay here again. Ask for a room above the lobby.

The overall location, cleanliness, friendliness of the staff and breakfast was a good experience. My disappointment was in the way the manager handled the problem of the heater in my room not working. My group had brought in the New Year at Knotts Berry Farm and arrived at the hotel after 1am. I tried to turn on the heat, but the heater only blew out cold air. Since the room was already in the low 40's or hight 30's, I turned off the heater altogether. I went to bed and when I woke up It was so cold I could hardly get out of the bed.  I dressed and went to the desk clerk and told him the heater was not working in my room. This hotel had very friendly service, large and accomodative rooms, A beautiful pool area and hot tub with good hours but a less than adequate continental breakfast.  We were immediately brought towels and ammenities when we asked for them  It was a great that they offered free wi fi!  We loved the close driving distance to shopping and Disneyland as well!

Summary Heading: One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at
Summary: Very inexpensive rates which is nice. Very cramped rooms. Carpet quite dirty. Half of the tv channels didn't even work. The shower water was nice and hot for about the first 10 minutes of your shower then it got ramdomly very hot and very cold. The hotel staff was quite rude. Our air conditioner and heating was broken. They then wanted to move us once we had already settled in. There was a wedding while we where there. And they had bagpipes playing loud as can be right by the rooms at 7am. They could've simply moved away into the parking lot or to the front of the hotel, near the office. Hotel staff was rude when I called and asked if they could move away from the rooms. The continental breakfast was just okay. No complaints with that really. They did have free wifi but it was

Summary Heading: The first time, wont b the last time!
Summary: This was my first visit to a Howard Johnson Inn, and I was very impressed, from the very friendly staff, appearance, to the spotless, spacious upgraded rooms an amentities, it was my favorite of all 60+ rooms i've stayed in this year through out the Wyndhum chain. Kudos hojo keep up the good work. Wm.Tyler Davis rewards member
Manager Response: Dear Tyler Davis, i am glad you found your stay enjoyable. and Thank you for your review and we look forward to welcome you soon. Sincerely, Ricardo F.

Summary: The location was not close to our Long Beach, California business appointments nor friends but we could not beat the price anywhere closer. Yes, we would consider staying here again.   The breakfast was good.  The service was very good but we had to have our room keys reprogrammed every other day.  We wished there was an adult only area so small children did not keep us up at night and wake us early with running and screaming.

Was much much better than expected from a hojo. Room was very clean  desk clerk very helpful & courteous. Room was spacious.  Breakfast was not listed but a nice continental breakfast was included.  Pool was freezing so didn't get in hottub was probably hot enough but extremely small.  Clean though!

Clean and affordable room!  Checked in at 11:00pm with no problems.  Room was clean.  Didn't like the fact that breakfast was from 6am to 9am.  When you are on vacation you want to be able to sleep in.  The only other down side was that you can hear the people in the hallway and the next room.  Overall we like it and location to theme parks was awesome.
The accommodations were more than expected. Had a room with outside patio. Very clean, comfortable, nice. Quiet and free parking.
The hotel room was not clean, old and run down. The air conditioner sounded like it was going to fall off the wall. I am terribly disappointed for the price they charged!

Summary Heading: Injured foot on nail in BEDROOM!
Summary: I never expected a nail to be sticking out of the floor, cut my foot, called the desk, they sent a handyman with 2 bandaids, one of which was open not in a wrapper & neither fit the wound, then he borrowed some from housekeeping. No elevator, no accident report & the desk clerk yelled at me for not coming from Disney land to talk to the mgr at 10pm when the office was closed & dark. No one called me nor left a note in my room! The nail went into my foot & I am having trouble walking now! There was no elevator & the 'continental" breakfast consisted of oatmeal mix, some quartered oranges, & coffee w/ powder creamer. I am going to see a doctor tomorrow.

Summary Heading: good value for the tourist areas
Summary: This is good value considering they offer a breakfast.  They also offer one shuttle to DL in the morning and one returning in the evening, but the times weren't really convenient if you want to get there for before it opens and stay to the end...it leaves before the fireworks.  A cab is about $25 each way.  One big thing that sets this hotel apart from being a really great hotel was the towels! LOL! They were so worn, little and hard.  I couldn't find any pool towels either.

Summary Heading: The rooms are large!  We liked that since there are 3 of...
Summary: The rooms are large!  We liked that since there are 3 of us.  However, they did not give us enough towels and when I called for more, they told me I had to go to the lobby to get my own.  When I did, they did not have any washcloths.  The housekeepers did a GREAT job cleaning the room and even folded our blankets that we brought with us.  Easy on and off the freeway.  About 13 minutes from Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Your Review      Rooms were not clean. Felt like they...
Summary: Your Review       Rooms were not clean. Felt like they didn't even vaccume. Our room key did not work several times had to go to front desk to fix it. Annoying!

Was on a road trip recently from San Diego to LA/San Fransisco /Las vegas. Needed a low budget clean motel/hotel. Stayed at this hotel Sep 10 to 13. Exceeded expectations. Clean rooms with clean sheets and washroom.. big enough to accommodate two queen beds. Quite neighbourhood with a couple of restaurants and McDonald nearby... Also a grocery store . Continental breakfast...included...Swimming pool looked clean though did not use it. Has separate common Laundry facilities. Just 30 Minutes drive from Hollywood( without traffic). If you are south Asian( Indian) this is about 7 Minutes drive from the location where there are many Indian restaurants and shops.. Quite good food .. tried the Udipi place

Expecting more from a hotel in a tourist area.  In one of the 3 rooms we rented the shower did not work.  The towels were dingy looking.  The room/bed were comfortable enough for the one night we were there.  We would not stay there again.
Manager Response: Please accept our apologies for the unpleasant experience you had with us. I will let our housekeeping and maintenance department know about the issues you mentioned to perfect those areas. We hope you will give us another opportunity to better serve you in the near future. Sincerely, Raymond

Summary Heading: I would not stay here again
Summary: Coming back from Disneyland, I found a cockroach on the bathroom counter the size of my finger. I also saw a pincher bug family hanging out in the bathtub. There are no windows in the bathroom. I am very displeased with the experience. My advice is to spend more money at another hotel unless you like a camp-like experience.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Please accept my apologies for the unpleasant experience you had with us. I will let our housekeeping and maintenance department know about the issues you mentioned. We hope you will give us another opportunity to better serve you in the near future. Sincerely, Raymond Choi .

Summary: PROS: I booked three rooms at this hotel for my daughters birthday party trip to Knotts Berry Farm, I originally wanted all three rooms next to each other but they only provided me with two rooms next to each other and the other room 3 doors down, which was not bad at all. The breakfast there is ok, waffles, cereal, toast, basic stuff.  They provided me with a Free Shuttle who dropped us off at Knotts and picked us up when we called to be picked up, this was very nice and saved us parking fees. There was ample room in the rooms for four people in each room. The pool was nice also. I would definitely stay here again on large trips like this since it was very economic and decent.   CONS: The other guest in this hotel though were something else. I guess that comes with economic

Summary Heading: Just what we were looking for!!!
Summary: Great place to stay I your going to an Angels Game!!! You can also stay here if your going to  Disneyland or Knott's Berry Farm. Good price, free internet, HBO, great  continental breakfast and offers transportation to parks...

Summary Heading: Relatively quiet location but good access to everywhere
Summary: We stayed here for Namm 2014 to be a touch away from the madness by the convention centre. This is a simple but clean accommodation. Rooms are large, breakfast is decent, parking ok. There is a very good Indian restaurant close by. Staff were very helpful and overall a very good stay.

The hotel was old and the rooms were incredibly old and outdated. It seemed like people were living in the rooms rather than temporarily staying for a vacation. People smoking outside. The shuttle to Disneyland is incredibly inconvenient, making you leave the park two hours earlier before the park even closes. I had initially booked 4 nights, ended up staying one night and canceled the rest!
This was a great trip, the hotel and staff were just great. It was close to everything we had to do. I would stay here again.

For the location it is superb value for money, staff were very helpful and rooms were secure and clean. Free breakfast is a bonus, although room was very busy at times. The only real downside was the pool, which could have been cleaner.

I understand you get what you pay for but HoJo's are not Motel 6's.  Our room was dingy, outdated and smelly.  The continental breakfast is a joke! We stayed 5 days and the apple juice was out of order EVERYDAY? Duing breakfast you "can't take the food out" but there's no wear to sit.Towels looked like they have been re-bought since the hotel opened in the 60's.  You can see through the towels and then they have the audacity to not have enough towels. Don't try to get a late check out here. They have a $20 dollar additional cost per hour. Air conditioning is off/on.  Iron Board did not have a cover?  Called front desk and they didn't have any more.  They gave us a table top????? This place is AWFUL pay the extra couple of bucks somewhere else!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This was a very nice hotel. The rooms were large and clean and the free  Wi-Fi pleased my family. The only reason I didn't give a 5 rating is because the free breakfast ends at 9 - vacations for us mean sleeping in - It would have been nice to have breakfast at 9 or 10 - and the rooms in front of the courtyard are pretty loud, but that's not really the hotels fault.
Room was nice and clean. Pool was cool. Chairs in room probably need to be replaced and carpet is so-so but overall a great room for the price! Thanks HoJo!  -Laura Guadian

They 1ST gave us room that was horrible with air on wall that didn't work.Luckily, they didn't give us a hard time and changed us to a better room. The weather was @ mid 90'S and they kept turning off air conditioner after cleaning (guess they wanted to save money) until I left them a note asking them not to turn off air. Also, at the same time we checked in they had two bus loads of people checking in so they were really busy, needless  to say we weren't able to do the breakfast for the 7 day stay since the tiny room was always full.OK hotel for price but i don't think i would stay here again.

So, my first impression of the room was "what a dump"! Apparently they have only remodeled some of the rooms. Our room was not a remodeled one. The room was CLEAN, which is very important and never saw a bug. There were small holes in the ceiling, there were spots on the walls that had been patched but not painted. Really, you couldn't paint the fixed patches? The WIRELESS DOES NOT WORK in the rooms that are not near the lobby. What else? The staff was pretty decent, had one guy ask me how old my laptop was because "it was so heavy" LOL, it is only 2 years old, haven't felt the need replace it yet, thought it was kind of a rude question. Towels are extremely thin, the beds were OK, was worried when I first sat on it but I slept fine. Air conditioner worked well, was not

First off let me say that for this hotel to be a Howard Johnson hotel it lacks expectations. We booked this hotel last minute and unfortunately we stayed here. I was very disappointed when we got to our room. It was outdated. Nothing nice at all about this hotel. I regret paying to stay here what a shame. Please remodel this hotel. It is horrible. Toiletries sucked and so did every detail of this room & hotel.  The a/c was as loud as a motorcycle driving by, literally. Never staying here again. On the other hand staff was friendly.

Check in was friendly. Hotel is on a good location for disney and other amusementpark. Citadel outlet near by. Hotel is old, although rooms are big enough. But rooms need an update. We used it on our way out of the city.

the hotel was just ok. the room was clean enough, better than expected for a budget hotel. its very close to Knottsberry Farm and 15 mins to Disney. The breakfast wasnt anything to brag about, but there are waffles. the room had a fridge and micro for your restaurant left overs and keep sodas cold. The room wasnt ready when we arrived around 1pm so we went to Downtown Disney to the Rainforest cafe. Service and food was excellant. Got an appetizer for my meal and it was alot.

Summary Heading: Disgusting. If this is your only choice for a hotel, then stay home.
Summary: This horrible hotel should PAY people to stay there.....There were vile stains on the chairs, furniture, carpets, towels and throughout the bathroom. The floors weren't clean.The beds were shoddy. The linen was torn. The hotel smelled terrible. The lights flickered and the A/C wouldn't stay on throughout the evening. And---the clerks' suggestions for restaurants were dreadful. When I asked for directions for Starbucks I was sent right into the Knott's Berry Farm traffic at rush hour....How thoughtful...I won't even talk about the place they suggested for dinner. It's a good thing my group had a sense of humor about the whole hotel experience.

We stayed there 1 night and got there about 2pm. David, at front counter said we could check in early. We were going to a comedy show in Santa Monica that night and he gave us the best directions ever. Mapquest had us going up the 5 which he said would be alot of traffic. We saved alot of time. He also gave us great directions to Forest Lawn Cemetery which we going to the next morning. Again, saved alot of time. Upon getting to our room,  the phone rang and it was David asking how our room was and if we needed anything! We were very impressed. The room was clean, comfortable, nice amenities (I like the San Francisco Soap Co.),everything worked. Breakfast the next morning was good. I really liked the self made waffles. Only thing I didn't like about this hotel we were on 2nd
The air didn't work the floors were not clean and you could not get breakfast due to the small dining area.  Twice during the stay we were locked out and it was late at night.

Summary Heading: Hotel was at a great location for me to stay for the...
Summary: Hotel was at a great location for me to stay for the evening. When I arrived the staff was very friendly and they found my reservation without any problem. However, the room was very hot when I entered so I immediately turned on the A/C. But other than that I had a good stay.

Arrived late. After lobby was already closed and was not happy about the rate for such a short stay. Was staying just to sleep. The next morning the shower kept getting real hot and then real cold. What is usually one of my favorite times in the morning was very uncomfortable and annoying. Coffee station looked as if the pods had been sitting for a while and they were very small.

The staff was very helpful. I did not mark the breakfast area my husband went to get breakfast for me so I did not comment on that area. The pool area I did not go to. That question was marked by mistake. Thank you

Summary Heading: Our stay was ok.  Could tell rooms were older hotel...
Summary: Our stay was ok.  Could tell rooms were older hotel.  Continental breakfast was very minimal and even went out for coffee.  Wouldn't be top choice if/when returning to area.

While we set our expectations low, given the modest room rate, we were annoyed and troubled by four issues. First, the room electronic door locks malfunctioned with multiple key cards forcing us the take the long walk to the front desk several times. Secondly, for a three day stay, room service was unable to provide us washcloths. They "ran out" of washcloths. Thirdly, room service neglected providing packets of coffee for our rooms after the first night. Lastly, toilet paper here was in very short supply. The continental breakfast area was packed, with considerable wait times for simple food items. Staff was courteous. Vending machines are behind locked doors after 10 pm. Pennywise, yet pound foolish business practices reflect poorly on the Howard Johnson brand.

Summary Heading: Hotel staff were very friendly and efficient. The rooms are...
Summary: Hotel staff were very friendly and efficient. The rooms are standard, old fashioned themed, and need to be upgraded. Property is situated in a nice location. Internet has a very bad connection; therefore practically useless. The breakfast area was clean and friendly staff.

Summary Heading: I was very happy with the person that checked me in.  He...
Summary: I was very happy with the person that checked me in.  He was very helpful and friendly.  The rooms were nice, but the television channels offered were horrible unless all you want to watch is news and sports.  There was only nicktoons for the kids and there was very limited selection of other channels.  The toilet seat was old and damaged and needed to be replaced, but it was clean.  There was a roach in the pool so that grossed us out a little, but I guess that's better than being in the room.  We used the shuttle for Knott's Berry Farm and he was 20 minutes late picking us up from the park.  We raced out there to be on time so he wouldn't leave without us and he wasn't even there.  The breakfast was good and I really like that they offer waffles.

by looking at pictures on wedsite, we were unable to know that this was a much older hotel than any that we have stayed at.  there were stains in carpet, very low voltage lighting, chairs with no support in middle, air conditioner when shutting off sounded as if someone was pounding on wall, no elevator only outside stairs but if you wanted to save money and only needed it for sleeping, you might still want to stay there.

this room was the worst from the service to the broken ac and furniture. the breakfast was horrible. the bed had bugs. I would never stay there again the building should be condemned. and they are not handicap friendly either, they make no arrangements for the physically impaired.

I travel a lot either to SFO or LA for my business purposes and for family. It is well budgeted it is well budgeted hotel. The only thing I didn't like was the breakfast needs some more variety of fruits and some individual cream cheese cups for the bagels. Rest was good. ..The front desk clerk Amy was good and accommodating

The exterior is very nice. When you see it you expect it'll be a decent hotel. The staff is wonderful. They are very friendly and helpful. One night when we opened our door to get into our room, we were greeted by a giant roach. The room was dingy. The towels were really old and thin. The pillows were very lumpy. The beds were small and uncomfortable. It was only ten minutes away from Disney Land, so that was nice. The room was a little dark and needed more lighting. There was quite a bit of dust on the shelf above the closet area. The TV didn't work well and the remote did not work at all. The wifi would work for a few minutes and then stop working for long periods of time. Using the wifi was pretty much impossible.

Summary Heading: guest service were nice, room looked ok but needed paint,a...
Summary: guest service were nice, room looked ok but needed paint,a new tub and shower curtain had stains and a hole in it. Popcorn celings had dust hanging from it that blew with the air conditioner. nice pool small jacuzzi but very warm. area had plenty of shops and resturants. just a few upgrades would go a long way. bed was very comfortable.

I knew when booking this hotel I would be getting what I paid for.  I knew that it was a cheap price and we just needed a place to stay for one night.  Next time it would be worth it to upgrade for the one night. Two compliants.  1. I booked this thru hotels.com which on the website a infant/toddler was available at no extra cost.  So on our way to the hotel I called to have the bed set up for when we got there since we wouldn't be coming in until midnight.  I called around 8pm. They said they didn't have access to the infant beds this late since housekeeping was gone for the night! If this is the situation they should say that on the website. This made me very mad! What if we needed extra pillows or blankets when we got there would we be SOL then too since housekeeping was

The lady at the front desk was neither welcoming or helpful. She gave us our room key and did not even point us in th e right direction. Luckily we found the room on our own. The bed was very stiff. The ironing board was very dirty. We had to g back down to the front desk for a replacement iron because it was dirty and useless as well. The iron she replaced it with did not work at all. The TV service was terrible. The wifi did not work consistently. The positives were that there was ample parking and that the refrigerator and microwave worked well.

We have stayed at HJ when it was a Travel Lodge and it has improved since changing hands. This trip was our 17 consecutive stay and we will never stay anywhere else. The location and prices are incomparable. Our daughter is autistic and this hotel is quiet and we stay near the back for her sensory concerns. She gets her own bed and she loves the swimming pool and Disney posters.

I stayed at this hotel previously two years before. I had no problems with it then, other than the pool & hot tub were closed for remodeling. The housekeeping was great, breakfast was sufficient, staff was very friendly and helpful. This time was no different. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The pool & hot tub were open. Breakfast was the same, however, there were a few tour buses that took all the tables, slowed bfast down a bit, it was resolved after a cpl days.  The only complaints I had were being so far from the office, the internet connect was basically non existent and I really needed it. Housekeeping did not ask if we wanted linen or changes if we did not have the sign on the door. We had a couple noisy neighbors, but that is not something the hotel can really

I've been to a couple hotels and never got the service like I have at this hotel. They have great customer service and very please each time I come here. People here are very friendly. This place makes me feel safe which is one main thing I look like. I will always comes to this place and never again to other hotels I've been to.

If not for being awakened at 6:34 a.m. because the headboard wall was shared with the breakfast room, and finding a roach in my wife's pants that crawled all over her inner thigh when she put them on. . .the property and amenities were very good.  Better than expected, actually.
Not enough ligting, the staff were not very helpful. I had to carry my own luggage bag up one floor, the bath tub was not clean!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: This motels pretty much lied about everything. It was close to Knotts but not so much to Disneyland. And when they say the provide complimentary shuttle service to the parks what they should really say is "if we have a driver available and only if you make an appointment". We had some friends take is to Disneyland on the last day of our vacation and before we left, I called the front desk and specifically asked what time the Disneyland shuttle would be picking up that evening. I was told 10pm. I called again about 5pm that evening just to confirm and was told that since I had not called and made arrangements that morning to bed picked up that night they didn't have an available driver and would not be doing a pick up. Total crap. So it cost is $30 in cab fare. Then when we get

Summary Heading: Location for me was very good because we were going to...
Summary: Location for me was very good because we were going to knotts berry farm.  But the next time, I'd rather spend more money to be in a hotel that is clean and updated.  The rooms were very dark and air conditioning didn't really work at all.  If it were warmer weather, I probably would've checked out and went somewhere else. There were bugs flying around and on the walls.  The door was not sealed well because I could see a big gap in one corner of it.  The halls near my room was full of cigarette odors. Towels were extremely thin, stained, and dirty. There were yellow stains everywhere and blood stains were very visible. The "white" towels were not so "white".  I thought this stay would be decent because I saw "Wyndham"  and we have stayed at a Wyndham Resort in the past. I will

Very pleased, just wish the continental breakfast was a little better.  Will say I am writing this at my next hotel- a Hojo in Las Vegas- 75675505 I may not last the week here- it is terrible- the bed is like a rock, the pillows are terrible, it stinks of cigarettes, parking is terrible.  Not at all like any of my other Wyndham experiences!  Lamp shades broken, no desk, shower head at dwarf height, etc.

Summary Heading: Not good for Disneyland fans!  I was told there was a...
Summary: Not good for Disneyland fans!  I was told there was a shuttle and that it was close to Disney.  There was only one shuttle each day in each direction.  It left the hotel an hour after the park opened and returned to the hotel during the fireworks!  Walls are paper thin and we were woken up at 6:00am when people started moving around.

Summary Heading: Great service from the start. The check in was friendly and...
Summary: Great service from the start. The check in was friendly and all the amenities were explained in detail. The staff was very knowledgeable about the stores and shops near by. Rooms were clean beds comfy. My favorite thing was the grill. We were tired of fast food and bought steaks and grilled them. The only complaint I have is the pool had way too much chlorine. My black shirt is now brown. I will definitely be staying next time I travel to Buena Park. Maybe I'll swim in the Ocean next time.

Summary Heading: The outside of the hotel is great, it's inside the rooms...
Summary: The outside of the hotel is great, it's inside the rooms where the problems are. Bathrooms were dirty.

Summary Heading: Thin walls , loud air conditioner and smokey rooms!!!
Summary: We stayed in a non smoking room but they have smoking sections or court yard all around these non smoking rooms.so needless to say my room smelled like a lit cigarette. I called the front desk and she said nothing she could do about it. The walls were super thin, air conditioner was so loud with a buzzer sound we couldn't even turn it on and hear the tv. The rooms looked like a old motel 6. The housekeeper did a good job but I will NEVER stay here again nor did I think it was worth the 100.00 a night!!!

The hotel is a little outdated and the bathroom door wouldn't lock but besides that the hotel was fine. It was clean and the beds were comfortable, there is coffee, a microwave, fridge and WiFi. This hotel was particularly close to most attractions in Buena Park including Knotts Berry which is about 2 turns away. The continental breakfast was nice but you got to get it early to beat the crowd, the best part of our stay was the very friendly and helpful hotel clerks. At check in, the clerk was very friendly and informative about the area and she informed me that I could use the lobby computer to print out discount tickets to Knotts Berry which they normally sell there but they were currently out.

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service and nice place to stay
Summary: The front desk people were aamazing. I had an issue and they did absolutely everything in their power to help me including staying on the phone and talking with the booking service for me to make magic happen with the additional support of Mumtaz. The lobby is very nice and There Is Even A COURTYARD Where You Can BARBEQUE If You want. They serve a full breakfast buffet and have a fridge and microwave in every room with  real cherry oak furniture.  The hotel is older but it is obvious that they clean it every time and it comes well stocked with shampoo etc which you don't get everywhere. The neighborhood is very quiet without any traffic noise either. I really appreciated my stay and am so grateful to Alfred and Mumtaz for being so much more helpful than they really had to be.
1. Dirty amenity, dirty mattress, stains on bed sheet, disgusting toilet 2. Staff did not respond to your complains. 3. Maid took my pajama for no reason. 4. Too noisy.
the front desk clerk (nancy) was not helpful at all nor the maintenance man.  The room had very dirty and stained carpet and a old odor smell. Wiill not return
Need to pay attention to odor in non smoking rooms air out guest rooms when vacant to remove the smell.

The only thing nice about our room was the comfy beds and pillows!  The bathroom had cracks in the ceiling & the towel were small and paper thin.  The walls & ceilings have no sound proofing, we could hear televisions, talking, showers and people knocking the doors on the floor above. For the price I paid it was NOT a good value.  I will NEVER stay there again!!!!

Comfortable bed, spacious room, very clean, nice and helpfull staff, and parking is near the room. Excellent shower.   Good breakfast, including waffles.   External areas are very welll kept.  I have stayed there twice and will stay again.
Rooms were close to the car. Staff was pleasant, the breakfast was way below average for $100.00 a night. I would stay there again if the price was 25% less.  Brad in Las Vegas Nv.

I spent the first 45 mins of my trip cleaning the room,There was a smell that never went away and the carpet had not been cleaned or vacuumed in many many days,I went through a entire package of clorox wipe clean the heater/air conditioner, Absolutely disgusting,The shower did not work all the time,and it leaked severely..The Breakfast area came complete with a breakfast nazi!! It was also waaaaay to small for the amount of people that where in there,stayed 4 nights never got breakfast or coffee...it was always out and being made with 15 people waiting ahead of me..Do yourself a favor and do not stay here!!

The room was clean and very spacious. We stayed in the "upgraded" section which was at the back of the property, detached from the main building. It was a little odd, but overall the room was nice, staff was great and its close to lots of attractions.
Disappointed.   The furnishings were quite dated.  WIFI was so slow as to be unusable.  The breakfast selections were unhealthy low quality and poor selection.
good hotel for the price- comfortable beds, clean sheets, nice continental breakfast (my boys loved the pancakes and waffles) Look forward to visiting again!

Summary Heading: Nice Property just very thin walls
Summary: I enjoyed this property. It was very clean and had great customer service. The only problem I had with it was that the walls were super thin. The first night there was a couple arguing in the room next to us until 2am. The last night I could here someone snoring in the room next to us like they were across the room from me.

I am not one to put places since I chose the price. You get what you paid for. But I do suggest they upgrade the bed. You can feel the springs with the touch of the hand. It also would be best not to advertise the jacuzzi since my kids called it the master bath tub. One family at a time. Otherwise not bad for the price.

Summary Heading: Towels were suppose to be white and you could see the dirt...
Summary: Towels were suppose to be white and you could see the dirt in them. Breakfast area too small and they don't want you to take food out so people were standing trying to eat. I told the staff someone spilled something on the floor she wiped it up with a towel that was already laying on the floor and then continued preparing the food in the breakfast area, she never changed her plastic gloves. The rooms neef to.b updated n the walls were dirty too. Nit a comfortable stay at all.

The property is in need of an update. The front desk staff was friendly, but I think in training as our room keys did not work upon initial use.  The pull out couch bed did not have any pillows and the front desk was unable to accommodate when called. The breakfast area was clean; however, the lady in charge of the area was not very pleasant. I would probably not stay again.
Clean, easy on and off freeway, centrally located to tourist attractions, decent breakfast, safe. "A"
Room had someone's belongings in it, rec said it was the maids. Room not cleaned, dirty towels on floor!

Summary Heading: Bed comfortable but hotel needs serious renovation
Summary: Hotel really needs a renovation. Bed was comfortable. However, walls are thin, can easily hear next door. Could never get stable water temperature from the bathroom faucet while washing face and brushing teeth. Got scalded twice! Carpets are dirty.

These people were so very nice and pleasant for our 2 night stay. They shuttled us to Knott's Berry Farm and the complimentary breakfast hit the spot! The room was clean and the bed was comfy. I will stay here again in the future for sure!

To be representing as a Howard Johnson hotel this hotel is pits! Seemed like they took over a crapy inn and never did any renovations. I will never stay at this location again. Also they only had one person on duty where I asked for and extra blanket and she replied "well you'll have to come and get it." After questioning it then her response was that she couldn't leave the front desk because she was the only one there. See if this ends up posted...

Put us in a row of rooms, separate from main hotel, they backed a storage unit type business, they ran a semi truck from very early in the morning until we would leave for the day.  Had to run water over 10 minutes to get it warm. It was a dark area and we were back in that section alone.  Check in unfriendly, unwelcoming and seemed like I had interrupted a tv program.

Summary Heading: Found hotel to be perfect for a business trip to the area...
Summary: Found hotel to be perfect for a business trip to the area. The price was fair for what is offered. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel and very close to the main attraction
Summary: It is very close to Disneyland and California Adventures, also close to many Outlets, the crew is very friendly and very helpful, I´ll be sure to use the same hotel when I come back the only thing that I would improve was the breackfast

We got what we paid for. Beds were comfy and guy at front counter was really nice but other than that it wasn't that nice. It had an odor in the room like it had just been cleaned but the smell never went away for our stay so it bugged us a little. But it was the cheapest hotel we found so we're ok with it.

Summary Heading: Ok for the amount we paid...
Summary: I have to say the beds were very comfortable, I was just worried to look at the cleanliness of the bedding, if it was anything like the rest of the room, very dirty and the towels were gross!

STAY AWAY. I had the misfortune to stay 2 nights. Room was rundown, outdated, filthy carpet, aircon so noisy it couldn't be used, noise from plumbing in other rooms drowned out tv!  Pubic and head hairs on bathroom floor (not ours...). I was disgusted and trapped a cockroach and left it in a paper cup instead of a tip. Yes, really! Housekeeping is very poor. On the plus side bed and pillows were fine.  If management reply to this it will probably not address the dirt issue as none of their previous responses have been any more than platitudes. I don't mind old decor, it's the squalor that got to me.

Room and bathrooms are good size..fridge and microwave work great..only down side is tub feels like it's sinking in the middle..we couldn't get the censored light to stay off at night and the curtains were not dark at all..over all I would stay again

When I went to go check in yo my room the lady was passed out on the counter nere the night  check in after about 10 min of me ringing to bell she woke up then was giving me a attitude about checking in at  11pm
not satisfied...everything! from room to carpet to bathroom, location feels unsafe too. not recommended

Pros: Staff is very friendly, and courteous.  Cons: Extremely noisy inside the room because the fridge is ancient. It makes a rattling sound the entire night preventing us from sleeping.   The rooms are filthy finished and you can see a lot of defects in the room.  I cancelled my other nights and left immediately after the first night. Horrible.. Horrible experience
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write a review for our hotel.  We appreciate all comments and concerns and address each one.  We are in the process of upgrading our rooms a few at a time.  We hope to have all rooms done soon.  We hope you will stay with us again on a future visit to the area to see our progress. Kind regards, Sherri

Summary: We picked this hotel for price and proximity to where we needed to be.  The outside is well-kept and has a pool and Jacuzzi.  There is also a barbeque area. The rooms are clean and functional, but a little run down with peeling paint, and outdated furnishings.  The staff is very friendly and the hotel is close to freeways and attractions.  There is no elevator, so carrying luggage to the 2nd floor was a bit of a chore. The breakfast room was full when we stayed there, with lots of families.  They offered cereal, waffles and pancakes along with juices and pastries. It was a perfectly satisfactory place for an overnight stay and the price was right for what we got.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write a review for our property.  We are glad you had a great experience while you were here.  We look forward to serving you again on a future visit to the area.   Kind regards, Sherri

Summary: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Howard Johnson in Buena Park, CA. We totally enjoyed Howard Johnson more than the Goodnite Inn right across the street. Sherri was very friendly and was able to get us into a room when we arrived early. Our room was not ready yet, but she was able to help. They called the room when we arrived to make sure it was to our satisfactory. Sherri was so friendly and remembered what our plans were that weekend. When we checked out she asked us how our visit to Knott's Scary farm was. I could not believe she remembered. The staff was nice and the non-smoking room was great. We recently quit smoking and it was nice to stay in a room not smelling of cigarette smoke! Thanks Howard Johnson and Sherri for making our stay in California wonderful!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write such a nice review for our hotel.  Our number one goal is guest satisfaction and we are happy we provided you with excellent service.  We hope you will chose us again on a future visit to the area. Kind regards, Sherri

Summary: Free shuttle to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm.   We got a king-sized bed and the room also came with a double bed, so we could have had an extra guest if we wanted. This hotel is great for anyone on a budget. Conveniently located, nice staff, clean rooms with fridge and microwave. They have a pancake machine for continental breakfast that makes good pancakes.   Staff went out of their way to get shampoo for me when some wasn't readily available. Safe neighborhood for parking, Stater Bros. grocery store nearby and lots of fast food options. It was really easy to make a reservation for this place. There's plenty of outdoor space for smokers and even a BBQ grill. The pool/spa looked clean but I didn't get to use it. Will stay there again next time in Buena Park area.

This was a smoking room which we didn't want but surprisingly it didn't smell very smoky.  I am kind of a germaphobe so the sticky alarm clock was sort of gross but really, the bed was comfy, the room was big, shower worked great.  It was nice to have the fridge and microwave.  We were able to save money by eating in the room which was nice.  A/C worked awesome! We arrived around 3AM and had to check in at the night window.  The lady gave us prompt, friendly service and we were in our room within minutes.  The room was very quiet too!  No real complaints except for the towels are thin and small, the pool was pretty cold and hot tub not very hot...but all no

Okay folks, some of the reviews aren't quite accurate. The bathroom was completely remodeled as of May 2011,the lighting is good for a 2 star hotel,I removed hair from the comforter and the box spring definately needs to be replaced. For the price,and Ive stayed at places cross country is well worth it. The room is 2-3x the size of a modern room,somewhere about 400 sq ft,clean towels bathrooms,the comforters and bedding have seen better days,but the hotel is very quiet,free waffles at the continential bfast.

We live in LA, but were going to Knotts. . We got two rooms for my family and I (2 kids, 4 adults) We ended up going back home, no refund!!!! The rooms are pretty small, think motel6. The walls could use a fresh coat of paint, and the bathroom feels like a jail cell and has seen better days, Seriously, hotel needs a make over. Shower was clogged, curtains ripped, mini fridge dirty!!!  This hotel is located next to Beach blvd, which is notorious for prostitution.   When we went down to the pool area, noticed a lot single young ladies checking in. On our way back to the room, saw a bunch of men in the yard drinking and smoking away. that was the last straw!!!

I had read some not great reviews about this place and was kind of weary of staying here on our Disneyland trip. But, we waited too long and everything in Anaheim got booked, so HJ it was. And it was a wonderful stay. We had 3 adults and a baby, and had arranged to have the crib set up in our room for our very late (11pm) check in. It was there all ready and comfy, the room was large, clean, and smelled great. The beds were great and we all slept wonderfully. The shower was incredible and even after we all took long ones, the hot water was still coming. I was worried it would be loud because our room was close to the breakfast room, but we couldn't hear any noise outside our room. The breakfast in the morning was yummy. It is a continental breakfast, I really don't know what

The only good thing about this place was that the rooms were very big and had a mini frige and microwave. The room was poorly lit and a lot of the lights didn't even work. The beds were super hard, the pillows like rocks. I woke up frequently during the night and in the morning was extremely sore, mind you I am only 23 years old! So I would consider that pretty bad! The bathroom was really run down and old. Not very clean at all, there were hairs and dirt already there. The floors were filthy, tile was cracked and uneven in some places. The shower head was dirty and the water hardly sprayed out. The towels were super scratchy and thin and would not even fit around your body. The toilet paper was literally PAPER. I could have ripped off a piece and took some notes on it! Overall

I left a toy I bought for my Great Grandson and he was playing with it while we checked out but left it behind.  When I called the hotel they said they'd call back (which they did NOT).  I recalled two days later and the manager said nothing ws found in the room.  Yes it WAS and I am glad it was a toy and NOT an expensive piece of jewelry.  I suggest that if you DO stay there be aware of EVERYTHING you bought with you and everything you bought and be sure NOT to leave anything behind!!!  Housekeeping will steal it  I will NEVER be staying at this hotel again.  Go across the street to the Good Nite Inn.

My husband and I stayed here on our trip to Disneyland. We were looking for an economical hotel close to the amusement park and we got just that. Our room was very spacious and the staff was extremely courteous. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks Howard Johnson!

The hotel did appear to be pretty nice from the outside and, despite the 70’s theme of décor in the rooms, they didn’t seem too horrible, but once I was settled between the sheets, I was attacked by disgusting bedbugs. At first I thought it was a spider, so I went to the front desk and asked them to send a maid up to change the sheets and vacuum. The next night, I woke up at 2:30am with bites all down my arms. I was horrified, and sat awake in the room with the light on trying to figure out what to do. That’s when I actually saw the bugs crawling on the sheets. I took my baby and went and slept in my van. This is going to be ridiculously expensive to take care of now that we’re home. I just found out that these bugs will get into your clothing and luggage and come home with you.

This hotel appears from the street, as a decent HoJo. However, once you park after check in, it all time warps back into 1974. Our room had a king size bed. It was comfy enough but I was worried about bugs or something just from the looks of it. Summary: I was looking for a cheap motel near the Disney theme parks, and this is exactly what I got.  (And the theme parks (Disney & Knotts) are only about 5 miles away, NOT 30 miles away as another reviewer said.)  I was pleasantly surprised with my room, it was quite large with a king bed and computer desk.  Free internet was great.  Bed was comfy but pillows a bit hard, it was only on the 3rd night that I found a softer pillow stuffed at the back top corner of the wardrobe.  There was a fridge, microwave and sink in the room, but it would have been good if they provided plates and cutlery.  Guest laundry was good except the front desk did not sell washing powder. Speaking of the breakfast, it included Belgian Waffles, fresh fruit, toast, apple/orange juice, coffe, and milk. We didn't get to check out the pool as we were at Disneyland everyday we were there.   The rooms are a little dated, but you can tell they are trying to get them up to par. Each room had a sink, fridge, microwave, cuboards, table, armoire, nightstand, etc...

I enjoyed our stay here at the Howard Johnson (I think they were changing from Travelodge).  In any case, my family and I are on tight budget and wanted something cheap for the kids.  We decided to go to Knott's for the weekend.  We looked around and decided on here to stay for our vacation and were impressed with the place.  First the front desk was very pleasant and nice, addressing all of our questions we had about getting directions to our destinations.  The room were great too.  I like the fact that I was able to put our drinks and food into our refridgerator to keep cold (i like my drinks cold).  The beds were bigger than we expected and were pleasantly suprised. Well, to say just a few things about this Travelodge....First our door would not lock because the deadbolt was broken. The door latch was completely broken off. I ended up wedging a chair up against the door for the night.  We found a dirty sock in one of the beds. The toilet was filthy. I had to clean the bathroom before we could use it. The shower was moldy. The beds are old and sagging. The floor had not been vacuumed and my daughter stepped on a piece of glass and cut her foot.  Extremely ghetto. A family member booked the room for us not knowing the condition of the motel. Needless to say it was a long night.

The breakfast was a real joke. but then thats what you should expect anymore for $75.

Staff were friendly.  The breakfast was limited, but reasonable for an economy hotel.  I would definitely stay again.

The shower head was way too low and I hit my head on it (I am only 5' 3" tall.)  It was a very hot day and the air conditioning unit mounted on the wall leaked water continuously.  I had specifically asked for a smoking room but got a No Smoking room and when I called to ask about it I was told that I would need to wait until the following day to change rooms.  The "deluxe continental breakfast" consisted of toast, juice, cereal and some fruit.  I could have fed my family that in the room with my own money. We were group of 5 adults, 2 teenagers, and eleven year old.  We wanted place close to Disneyland, California Adventure, and Universal Studios.  The Anaheim area hotels were generally higher in cost and reviews were low.  This hotel was rated #2 in Buena Park and price was great--$59 each for adjoining rooms.  We arrived late and received rooms midway on the ground floor.  Both smelled musty to point I asked to be relocated.  We received adjoining rooms midway on 2nd floor which were fine.  Lots of amenities for price.  Good parking, easy to find, lots of restaurants in area, 10 minutes to Disneyland, 45 minutes to Universal Studios. Deluxe continental breakfast was minimal quality.  Desk clerk was very accomodating.  Would stay again...

We booked this on the Travelodge web site and got an unbelivable rate $5 a night - we promptly got a call from the manager there to say they wouldn't honour it but gave us a $39 a night rate for each of two rooms which was brilliant value! The hotel is in a really accessible location and the rooms are clean and beds big. We had 2 interconnecting rooms both with a fridge (rather old) and a cooker or microwave - no crockery. utensils or cutlery though!!  The rooms were kept clean and tidy. The pool was great for the children and the BBQ meant we could cook rather than constantly eating out. There was an internet facility in the Lobby ($1 per min)and constant coffee provided there. Summary Heading: Great for families w/ small children
Summary: We stayed there this weekend w/2 small children, and we had a pleasant experience. The room was very clean, beds had new linen and were comfortable, we had asked for double beds and got a king size and a double!; room has kitchenette, staff was great, helpful. My kids loved the breakfast, there was internet service in the lobby, nice pool/spa, and even has laundry room. Great budget hotel for families. Good location if you're going to Knotts. Close to shops, atrractions and freeway.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel - very good value for the price! Rooms were clean, quiet and the staff was very nice and helpful.  The free breakfast was great, with fresh grapefruit and oranges every morning as well as breads, cereal, and doughnuts. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for budget accomodations.

I stayed here recently while on vacation with the family.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the free breakfast was great.  I've stayed in many places where they just have donuts in the lobby but the Travelodge Buena Park had this cute breakfast room where they served a fresh continental breakfast.  They also had a free shuttle to Disneyland - I'll be coming back next year!
